resources.string: Brno is the second largest city in the Czech Republic by population and area, the largest Moravian city, and the historical capital city of the Margraviate of Moravia. Brno is the administrative center of the South Moravian Region in which it forms a separate district (Brno-City District). The city lies at the confluence of the Svitava and Svratka rivers and has about 400,000 inhabitants; its greater metropolitan area is home to more than 800,000 people while its larger urban zone had a population of about 730,000 in 2004.
#1 of 8 Spas and Wellness in Brno
Masaze Brno - Masaze, Shiatsu a Bowenova technika
The Brno Reservoir, previously known as the Kníničky Reservoir is a dam on the Svratka River right outside the city of Brno, Czech Republic.
Brno Zoo, is a Czech zoo, located in Brno in Czech Republic. In 2000, Brno Zoo became member in World Association of Zoos and Aquariums.
Lužánky is the largest city park in Brno and the oldest municipal park in the Czech Republic. The park is located in the Brno-střed District and covers an area of 22.3 hectares.
Large botanical garden with orchids and exotic flora in a greenhouse, plus a vineyard and a cafe.
Jungle park is a rope center located in the heart of Brno.
Built in the heart of the Brno, the Open Gardens has been functioning as a textbook of environmentally friendly architecture, sustainable agriculture and modern environmental protection.
Opened in April 2012, located on the Vegetable Market in Brno\'s centre, Grandezza Hotel Luxury Palace is a luxurious boutique hotel featuring a hand-painted glass ceiling and marble mosaics.
Situated on Silingrovo Square in a prestigious historical building known as Mestsky Dvur, the 5-star Barceló Brno Palace can be found in the heart of the city.
The Avanti hotel is located 200 metres from Brno\'s large Kralovo Pole shopping mall with a sports centre including swimming pools and fitness facilities.
Situated on one of the oldest streets in Brno, the Starobrněnská Street, the romantic Royal Ricc Hotel is right in the historical heart of the city.
Looking back on a 140 year-long tradition in hospitality, this centrally located hotel in the heart of Brno\’s picturesque old town is close to all major sights.
The Best Western Premier Hotel International Brno is centrally situated right below Špilberk Castle in the city centre.
The Orea Hotel Voronez next to the Brno Trade Fair grounds (Veletrhy Brno) offers conference facilities, fine cuisine, inviting rooms and easy access to the city centre.
Located in the Sono Centrum complex, in the centre of the musical scene and featuring a music club and a restaurant, Sono Hotel offers a modern design, free WiFi access, etc.

Located a 10-minute walk from the city centre, eFi Hotel was built in 2014 and offers self-catered apartments, free WiFi, an outdoor swimming pool with a summer bar, a fitness centre and a wellness area.
